question_text: Which of the following are valid differences between network taps and port mirroring? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Taps are passive hardware devices, while port mirroring is software-configured
Taps can operate without switch configuration changes
Port mirroring guarantees complete traffic capture under all conditions
Taps may be more expensive but provide more accurate captures
correct_answer: Taps are passive hardware devices, while port mirroring is software-configured
Taps can operate without switch configuration changes
Taps may be more expensive but provide more accurate captures
explanation: Taps are inline devices that provide reliable traffic duplication without taxing switch resources, unlike port mirroring which depends on the switch's performance.
